messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fwd: [FOODALLERGYKITCHEN] How contagious is  vaccinia?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Should the Govt use the powers granted to it by the Patriot Act then having an immuno-deficiency isn t going to stop you being marched at gunpoint to get
messages.messageBody:
Liza Sabater wrote:

> > Until these controversies are settled, hospitals must be certain that
> > the rush to vaccinate health care workers does not result in a
> > self-inflicted epidemic  not of smallpox, but of infection with the
> > live, potentially lethal virus, vaccinia.
>
> Extremely important information from the New England Journal of
> Medicine regarding the rush to vaccinate people against smallpox. This
> is especially important information for people with hiv, asthma,
> rheumatoid arthritis and eczema (atopic dermatitis) and other
> immune-deficiencies.
>
> Begin forwarded message:
> > http://content.nejm.org/cgi/content/short/348/5/439
> >
>
> liza
>

Should the Govt use the powers granted to it by the Patriot Act then having an immuno-deficiency isn't going to stop you being marched at gunpoint to get your shot. None of my kids are vaccinated. We
obtained a religious and moral exemption to the requirement when enetering the 'land of the not-so-free'. They all have eczema and I have MS :-(
Should the mass vaccinations start we will be on the first plane outta here whatever the cost of same day tickets.

run away run away....

Shyrley

messages.subject: Fwd: [FOODALLERGYKITCHEN] How contagious is vaccinia?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Extremely important information from the New England Journal of Medicine regarding the rush to vaccinate people against smallpox. This is especially
messages.messageBody:
> Until these controversies are settled, hospitals must be certain that
> the rush to vaccinate health care workers does not result in a
> self-inflicted epidemic � not of smallpox, but of infection with the
> live, potentially lethal virus, vaccinia.

Extremely important information from the New England Journal of
Medicine regarding the rush to vaccinate people against smallpox. This
is especially important information for people with hiv, asthma,
rheumatoid arthritis and eczema (atopic dermatitis) and other
immune-deficiencies.

Begin forwarded message:
> http://content.nejm.org/cgi/content/short/348/5/439
>

liza


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
